result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Bryce L Dilger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryce L Dilger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryce L Dilger was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: W/H adjudication on ct 3 pending completion of FOP.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$200 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. May not live anywhere there is controlled substances, paraphernalia or alcohol.
Complete Deferred Prosecution Opiate Program.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Ct reinstates the $2000 bond previously posted on 9/10/15 at 1 pm. W/H adjudication on ct 3. Bail continued on ct 3.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

AMENDED CASH BOND on count 3 (FOP)  -  RE-REFERRAL TO BMP 
- Cash bail is set at $5,000 per case. This cash bail shall revert to $2,000 per case on 09-10-15 at 1:00 p.m. conditioned on Drew Van Hyfte being present at bail release window.  Cash Bail of $2,000 previously forfeited on 8-24-15 is reinstated and shall be applied toward this reduced bail.  Defendant must report to BMP on Friday 9-11-15 at 8:00 a.m.  Defendant must cooperate with all rules of BMP.  
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shops or resale stores.  
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not live anywhere there is controlled substances, or drug paraphernalia or alcohol.
- Defendant shall complete Deferred Prosecution Opiate Program.

AMENDED CASH BOND -  RE-REFERRAL TO BMP 
- IF DEFENDANT POSTS $5,000 CASH BOND, HE CANNOT BE RELEASED UNTIL SIGNED UP WITH BMP
THE $2,000 PREVIOUSLY POSTED BOND IS FORFEITED.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court.  Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000 per case.   If the defendant posts cash bail,  and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM.  The defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release.  If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.  The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.  
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shops or resale stores.  
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

If defendant is not released by May 22, 2015 at 3:45 PM, cash bail will not revert to a signature bond until May 26, 15 at 5:00 AM. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts. Court found probable cause as to Counts 1 and 3. Probable cause held open as to Count 2.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
